alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 02 at 2:08PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Weak system expected tonight into Friday with a second, stronger winter storm slated to arrive by Saturday evening... * A weak system is expected to push through northeast California tonight into Friday. Southwest winds will begin to increase this evening with gusts along the ridges of 50 to 70 mph and 30 mph or less in the lower elevations. Winds will begin to diminish late Friday afternoon. * Light snow showers will move into the Sierra on Friday. While accumulations are expected to be minimal, we may see up to 2 inches above 5500 feet west of US-395. Keep in mind that even light accumulations on the roadway can create slick and hazardous conditions. * A more potent winter storm is still expected to move into the area Saturday evening through Sunday. This system will bring more widespread wind and snow impacts. Total snowfall accumulations of 1 to 5 inches will be possible above 5000 feet, with 7 to 15 inches west of US-395. Stay tuned to forecast updates as we head into the weekend. In the meantime, download Caltran`s "Quickmap" application so you will have access to the latest information on California roadway conditions.
